publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1759 Christine Grahame: Meals on Wheels: A Vital Service—That the Parliament expresses its concern at the withdrawal of the meals on wheels service in the Scottish Borders, replacing it with a fortnightly delivery of frozen food; notes that carers, elderly people, consultants and other nursing staff at the Borders General Hospital Medical Services Directorate’s Department of Medicine for the Elderly have stated that stopping the service will result in a deterioration in elderly care in the Borders; deplores the fact that this practice has been adopted elsewhere in Scotland; notes that, although microwaves and freezers are provided where necessary, there are many frail and elderly who cannot cope with these gadgets, which may result in food being undercooked, running the risk of food poisoning; further notes that vital, often daily, human contact with the volunteers delivering the meals, sometimes the only human contact elderly people have in the day and a contact that at times has been life-saving, will be lost, and therefore calls on the Scottish Executive to require local authorities who have adopted this procedure to reinstate the meals on wheels service to those frail and elderly people who request it, giving them the dignity of choice which all Scottish citizens deserve. Supported by: Mr Adam Ingram*, Richard Lochhead*, Brian Adam*, Rob Gibson*, Linda Fabiani*
S2M-1759 Meals on Wheels: A Vital Service (lodged on 27 September 2004) John Swinburne*, Alex Neil*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Michael Matheson*, Mr Bruce McFee*
S2M-1759 Meals on Wheels: A Vital Service (lodged on 27 September 2004) Mr Andrew Welsh*
S2M-1759 Meals on Wheels: A Vital Service (lodged on 27 September 2004) Ms Sandra White*
